title: How to Prepare Authentic Spanish Mixed Paella

steps.headline: Scrub and debeard the mussels and clams.
steps.description: If you tap them sharply and they don't close, discard them; they're not safe to eat. Set them aside while working on your meat and veggies. If you're new to bivalve cleaning, scrub the outside of the shells. Then, using a knife, open the scallop shells and extract the meat. Remove the beard and the frilly outer membrane from each scallop muscle. The "beard" is an affection name for the byssal threads that attach the scallop to its shell.

steps.headline: Start slicing and dicing.
steps.description: It'll be much easier to get into a rhythm and avoid cooking in a frenzy if all your ingredients are ready for cooking. Grab out your cutting boards, knives, and bowls. For the meat, dice the pork, cut the chicken into chunks, and peel and devein the shrimp. The chorizo needs to be cooked beforehand. Brown your chorizo over high heat for 1-2 minutes. Do not fully cook; just get the outside well browned. Set aside (you may use the olive oil from the chorizo for the pork and vegetables). Cut the bell peppers into strips and the tomato, skinned and chopped. Both should be seeded. Mince the garlic and chop the onion into very fine pieces.

steps.description: oz) of olive oil. Once hot, add the pork and brown thoroughly on all sides. Mix in your veggies -- the garlic, onions, tomato, and bell peppers. Stir constantly until cooked and set aside. This should take around 6 minutes. Mix until the vegetables are soft and the pork is completely brown.

steps.headline: In a different skillet, heat another 1/4 cup (2 fl.
steps.description: oz) of olive oil. Now it's time for the chicken, which should also be cooked until brown on all sides. Season with salt, pepper, paprika, rosemary, thyme, and cumin. Set the chicken aside on a plate -- you'll get to it later. Olive oil is one of the healthiest oils to choose from. Don't worry!

steps.headline: In the same skillet as the chicken and over high heat, cook the lobster claws.
steps.description: They're ready when the shells turn pink (which should take a few minutes). Set the skillet aside, like always. The oil should have a good flavor from the chicken; you don't need to use a new splash.

steps.headline: Heat 4 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet and sauté the rice until it's translucent.
steps.description: Once it's ready, pour in the chicken broth and the pork mixture. Stir constantly, thoroughly combining the three concoctions. Sprinkle in the saffron and continue stirring. While you're doing this, preheat the oven to 200ºF (93ºC). For best results, use bomba, calasparra rice, or arborio rice.

steps.headline: Transfer the rice into a paella pan.
steps.description: Now's the time to get the party started -- as in, add everything else to the mix. Grab your lobster claws, chicken, chorizo sausages (or Andouille), mussels, clams, shrimp, peas, and capers, and stir thoroughly to combine. Throw it in the oven on the lowest shelf, uncovered, for around 25 minutes, or until all the liquid has been absorbed. Make sure the shrimp has turned pink and is fully cooked. If any mussels or clams have failed to open, discard them. Garnish with a few lemon wedges and serve the deliciousness straight outta the pan. If you like it spicy, add chilli sauce to taste.

text: Prepping the Ingredients Scrub and debeard the mussels and clams. If you tap them sharply and they don't close, discard them; they're not safe to eat. Set them aside while working on your meat and veggies. If you're new to bivalve cleaning, scrub the outside of the shells. Then, using a knife, open the scallop shells and extract the meat. Remove the beard and the frilly outer membrane from each scallop muscle. The "beard" is an affection name for the byssal threads that attach the scallop to its shell. Start slicing and dicing. It'll be much easier to get into a rhythm and avoid cooking in a frenzy if all your ingredients are ready for cooking. Grab out your cutting boards, knives, and bowls. For the meat, dice the pork, cut the chicken into chunks, and peel and devein the shrimp. The chorizo needs to be cooked beforehand. Brown your chorizo over high heat for 1-2 minutes. Do not fully cook; just get the outside well browned. Set aside (you may use the olive oil from the chorizo for the pork and vegetables). Cut the bell peppers into strips and the tomato, skinned and chopped. Both should be seeded. Mince the garlic and chop the onion into very fine pieces. Cooking Your Paella In a skillet, heat 1/4 cup (2 fl. oz) of olive oil. Once hot, add the pork and brown thoroughly on all sides. Mix in your veggies -- the garlic, onions, tomato, and bell peppers. Stir constantly until cooked and set aside. This should take around 6 minutes. Mix until the vegetables are soft and the pork is completely brown. In a different skillet, heat another 1/4 cup (2 fl. oz) of olive oil. Now it's time for the chicken, which should also be cooked until brown on all sides. Season with salt, pepper, paprika, rosemary, thyme, and cumin. Set the chicken aside on a plate -- you'll get to it later. Olive oil is one of the healthiest oils to choose from. Don't worry! In the same skillet as the chicken and over high heat, cook the lobster claws. They're ready when the shells turn pink (which should take a few minutes). Set the skillet aside, like always. The oil should have a good flavor from the chicken; you don't need to use a new splash. Heat 4 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet and sauté the rice until it's translucent. Once it's ready, pour in the chicken broth and the pork mixture. Stir constantly, thoroughly combining the three concoctions. Sprinkle in the saffron and continue stirring. While you're doing this, preheat the oven to 200ºF (93ºC). For best results, use bomba, calasparra rice, or arborio rice. Transfer the rice into a paella pan. Now's the time to get the party started -- as in, add everything else to the mix. Grab your lobster claws, chicken, chorizo sausages (or Andouille), mussels, clams, shrimp, peas, and capers, and stir thoroughly to combine. Throw it in the oven on the lowest shelf, uncovered, for around 25 minutes, or until all the liquid has been absorbed. Make sure the shrimp has turned pink and is fully cooked. If any mussels or clams have failed to open, discard them. Garnish with a few lemon wedges and serve the deliciousness straight outta the pan. If you like it spicy, add chilli sauce to taste. Finished.
